articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is the great disruptor of our time. Companies adopting AI have seen improvements in outcomes, efficiency and employee experience. Logistics is rapidly becoming a high-tech industry with digital transformation being top of mind. 67% of shipping and logistics firms say they have a formal digital transformation strategy in place to actively digitize business processes.

articles.title: South Africa is not ready for the coming white-collar AI bloodbath
articles.author: Independent online
articles.summary: Up to 50% of entry-level white-collar jobs could vanish in the next five years due to advances in artificial intelligence, according to Dario Amodei, CEO of Anthropic. Axios' article "Behind the Curtain: A White-Collar Bloodbath" details the topic.

articles.title: Ransomware gangs experiment with AI
articles.author: Sam Sabin
articles.summary: Ransomware gang is using AI chatbots to negotiate with their victims, according to research from Picus Security. Ransomware gangs are experimenting with AI-enabled tools in all aspects of their attacks, including coding and social engineering. Security experts warn of AI agents carrying out a detrimental cyberattack within the next year.

articles.title: Nick Cave admit his view of artificial intelligence as an artistic tool has begun to shift
articles.author: Music News
articles.summary: Nick Cave's view of artificial intelligence as an artistic tool has begun to shift after watching Andrew's surreal film. The Bad Seeds frontman has long been a vocal critic of AI technology. He previously described the technology as 'unbelievably disturbing' and warned of a 'humiliating' effect.

articles.title: The AI Coworker Is Here
articles.author: Nono Bokete
articles.summary: Nono Bokete is CEO, Data Sentinels, Empowering Businesses to Lead Digital Change—Beyond Just Technology. AI is changing the nature of how value is created in almost every field. Future-ready leaders use AI to think more clearly and integrate it into decision making, problem-solving and strategy.

articles.title: Google Trains Robot AI With Table Tennis
articles.author: Berivan Kilic
articles.summary: Google's DeepMind has left two robot arms to play table tennis without stopping. What does table tennis have to teach robot AI and what does this mean for robotics moving forward?      Â   i   in Google's Deep Mind's blog.

articles.title: JioPC turns your TV into AI computer: Story in 10 points
articles.author: India Today
articles.summary: JioPC turns your TV into an AI computer. It costs Rs. 1,000 in points per point.       in terms of data per point, so it's about Rs. 2,000 per point for JioPC.

articles.title: Writer launches a ‘super agent' that actually gets sh*t done, outperforms OpenAI on key benchmarks
articles.summary: Writer's new AI agent, Action Agent, outperforms OpenAI on key tests. The company spent just $700,000 to develop the agent. Writer has been working closely with Amazon Web Services and other industry players to bring MCP to enterprise standards. System provides audit trails showing exactly how the agent reached its conclusions and what actions it took.

articles.title: How US adults are using AI, according to AP-NORC polling
articles.author: Seattle PI
articles.summary: A new poll finds most Americans have used artificial intelligence to search for information. Younger adults are the generation leaning the most towards AI. Many of them use it for brainstorming and work, according to the poll.    iReporter.com: What do you think?

articles.title: With AI plan, Trump keeps chipping away at a foundational environmental law
articles.author: MELINA WALLING
articles.summary: Trump's plan to boost artificial intelligence and data centers is aimed at wiping away barriers to rapid growth. The president wants to create a new generation of data centers and artificial intelligence centers.   Copyright 2025 The Associated Press. All rights reserved. This material may not be published, broadcast or rewritten without permission.

articles.title: Cleo Becomes the First AI Money Coach That Speaks, Thinks and Remembers
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: Cleo, the world's first AI financial assistant, has launched Cleo 3.0. Cleo is designed to feel more like a human coach than an app. It helps users understand and improve their finances through deeply personalized, emotionally intelligent interactions. It learns each user's habits and provides expert, 24/7 guidance.

articles.title: Why AEC Leaders Should Treat AI As An Imperative, Not A Fad
articles.author: Claire Rutkowski
articles.summary: Claire Rutkowski is WSP U.S. Business Partner and Digital Transformation Advisor, and CIO, POWER Engineers, member of WSP, writes about the use of AI in the architecture, engineering and construction industry. She recommends a fail-fast approach where teams run a pilot on a use case to test and learn.

articles.title: Writer launches a ‘super agent' that actually gets sh*t done, outperforms OpenAI on key benchmarks
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: Writer, the enterprise artificial intelligence company valued at $1.9 billion, launched an autonomous 'super agent' Tuesday that can independently execute complex, multi-step business tasks across hundreds of software platforms. The new Action Agent represents a shift from AI chatbots to systems that can autonomously complete entire projects. Writer's agent includes enterprise-grade security controls and audit trails.

articles.title: AI Cuts Software Switch Costs In Half
articles.author: Undercovered Deep Insights
articles.summary: AI is cutting down the biggest hurdle in enterprise software swaps. It's bad news for Microsoft, Palantir, Salesforce, ServiceNow, and SAP. It automates mapping, testing and consolidation, slashing both time and cost roughly 50%. For legacy vendors, churn risk is rising and renewal talks are getting tougher.

articles.title: The future of skin allergy testing
articles.author: Class
articles.summary: Dr. Alison Bruce, a dermatologist at Mayo Clinic, is developing an artificial intelligence-powered tool to support allergy patch testing. It's a promising step toward faster, easier and more accessible skin allergy care for people in rural areas or those with limited access to specialists.

articles.title: (unpublished) I Tested 46+ AI Headshot Generators. Here are the Best 18 Tools Ranked for Realistic Results.
articles.author: paladmaria39
articles.summary: In 2025, artificial intelligence has revolutionized the way we create and manipulate images. AI image generators in 2025 have matured into powerful creative tools that democratize design. They eliminate the need for advanced artistic skills while still allowing detailed control and expression. The future of design isn't just assisted by AI, it's created with it.

articles.title: ‘AI veganism': Some people's issues with AI parallel vegans' concerns about diet
articles.author: David Joyner
articles.summary: New technologies usually follow the adoption life cycle with early adopters rushing to embrace new technologies, while laggards and skeptics jump in much later. New research on the reasons behind AI hesitancy suggests there are different dynamics at play that might alter the traditional adoption cycle. The study focused on college students who are often among the first demographics to adopt new technologies.

articles.title: Microsoft in advanced talks for continued access to OpenAI tech, Bloomberg News reports
articles.author: Reuters
articles.summary: Microsoft and OpenAI are in advanced talks for a deal that would give the Windows maker continued access to critical OpenAI technology in the future. The agreement could be reached in a matter of weeks. Elon Musk is suing OpenAI over the AGI clause. Microsoft is set to report June quarter earnings on Wednesday.

articles.title: The Future Is Now: How India Can Lead in the Age of AI
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence is transforming world economies. India is no exception to this trend as the world rushes towards intelligent technology.    i.e. the rise of artificial intelligence is transforming the world economies steadily. India's economy is no longer affected by this trend.

articles.title: The future of skin allergy testing may use AI-powered tool
articles.summary: Mayo Clinic is developing an artificial intelligence-powered tool to support allergy patch testing. The tool is being designed to help patients self-apply test patches and use their smartphones to capture images over time. It's a promising step toward faster, easier and more accessible skin allergy care for people in rural areas or those with limited access to specialists.

articles.title: Robin Williams's Daughter On AI, Matthew Lawrence Backlash
articles.author: Stephanie Soteriou
articles.summary: Zelda spoke out against artificial intelligence being used to recreate her late dad's voice. Robin Williams died by suicide in 2014 at the age of 63. He was very protective of the use of his voice work in life, and even feuded with Disney after they used his Aladdin character, the Genie, to sell merchandise. Matthew Lawrence, who worked with Robin as a child star, wants to use his voice to do something special in Robin's memory.

articles.title: AP-NORC Poll: 60% of Americans Use AI to Find Information
articles.author: Matt O'Brien
articles.summary: 60% of Americans use artificial intelligence to find information at least some of the time and 74% of those under 30 use it for brainstorming and work tasks. About 4 in 10 Americans say they use AI for work tasks at least sometimes, while about 1 in 3 use it to write emails, create or edit images, or for entertainment.

articles.title: How the Boston Celtics use artificial intelligence to make their team better
articles.author: Justin Quinn
articles.summary: The Boston Celtics are using artificial intelligence to improve their team's performance in the NBA. Mission, a CDW Company, put together a video with Jay Wessland, the CTO of the Celtics, explaining how they use AI for smarter shot analysis and a host of other techniques.

articles.title: Apple, Please Don't Let AI Ruin the iPhone 17's Camera
articles.author: Andrew Lanxon
articles.summary: As a professional photographer, I want to see the same dedication to taking better photos as Apple's iPhone cameras. Apple has invested in core image quality technologies, not simply used AI to make up for any hardware shortcomings. I'm braced for Apple's September event to be AI-focused.

articles.title: Vibing Our Way to Stupidity. Or Language is Not Intelligence. Or Turing Was Wrong
articles.author: angryea
articles.summary: The founder of Uber has said that working with a chatbot has helped him come close to making new discoveries in theoretical physics. This got him thinking about what humans take as a marker of intelligence. Large Language Models, the systems at the heart of imitative AI programs like Grok and ChatGPT are not reasoning about anything. They are calculating what should come next based on their training data. They can only string together what is in the training data and there are no new ides in material that has already existed. Alan Turing, one of the founders of the study of artificial intelligence, set as his benchmark for intelligence a communications test. We should be more serious about regulating these systems

articles.title: Steam Engines To Artificial Intelligence: Why Developers And Consultants Need To Rethink Now
articles.author: Marcus Banner
articles.summary: Marcus Banner is CEO of RealCore Group, digital transformation leader and IT author. He explains how AI is changing the work of developers and consultants. Leaders should understand where AI really adds value and where it's still experimental. They should encourage curiosity and experimentation, but also continuous thinking and refinement.

articles.title: Len Calderone: The Borg are coming
articles.author: Don Stilwell
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence will reach human level by around 2029. By 2045, we will have multiplied the intelligence of our civilization by a billion-fold. Ray Kurzweil, a computer scientist and author, explains the potentials of artificial intelligence (AI).

articles.title: Can AI Ever Become Conscious? (Or Is It Already?)
articles.author: BGR
articles.summary: Some critics of AI claim that the technology already demonstrates consciousness, while its defenders say such innovations are still far away. What's the truth? What's your opinion on AI? Share it with us on Facebook and Twitter.      Â

articles.title: Google AI Mode Is Causing Web Chaos And Traffic To Drop: Can Your Site Recover?
articles.author: Rohit David
articles.summary: Google's AI-generated summaries dominate search results, leading to fewer clicks on external sites. Small businesses that rely on organic traffic face a crisis in the £76 billion ($101 billion) digital advertising market. Google is rolling out tools like **AI Overview** (launched in May 2024), **AI mode** and the **Web Guide to adapt.

articles.title: CBA cuts jobs amid AI chatbot rollout
articles.author: Global Data
articles.summary: The Commonwealth Bank of Australia has terminated 45 call centre positions due to introduction of an AI chatbot. The bank is investing more than A$2bn in its operations, including frontline teams and technology services. The Finance Sector Union (FSU) has expressed discontent with the decision. CBA has recruited more than 9,000 individuals in the past year and has 670 vacancies within its retail banking services and frontline teams.

articles.title: CBA cuts jobs amid AI chatbot rollout
articles.author: Global Data
articles.summary: The Commonwealth Bank of Australia has terminated 45 call centre positions due to introduction of an AI chatbot. The Finance Sector Union (FSU) has expressed discontent with the decision. CBA has recruited more than 9,000 individuals in the past year and currently has 670 vacancies within its retail banking services and frontline teams. The bank is investing more than A$2bn ($1.30bn) in its operations.

articles.title: Google launches controversial ‘AI mode' in the UK
articles.author: Andrew Griffin
articles.summary: Google is launching its AI tool in the UK. The tool allows users to ask complicated questions and have them answered using artificial intelligence. It was launched in the US at the end of May, followed by India earlier in July. It will be available to all UK users over the next few days.

articles.title: AI bands signal new era for music business
articles.author: The Manila Times
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) bands are on the rise. Velvet Sundown's 1970s-style rock or country music projects "Aventhis" and "The Devil Inside" are AI-fronted bands with members who are pure AI creations.

articles.title: Meta's Zuckerberg bets hundreds of billions on AI data centers
articles.summary: Mark Zuckerberg wants to build several massive AI data centers for superintelligence. He is intensifying his pursuit of a technology he has chased with a talent war for top engineers. He wants to spend hundreds of billions of dollars on AI data centres.

articles.title: 5 Ways AI Agents Will Aid Human Engineers
articles.author: Naveen Edapurath Vijayan
articles.summary: Naveen Edapurath Vijayan is a Sr Manager of Data Engineering at AWS. He explains how AI agents are reshaping engineering teams and what leaders can do to embrace this evolution. AI agents don't replace engineers but make them significantly more effective.

articles.title: Bosch Digital's AI Leap Earns SAP Innovation Award Nod
articles.author: Tim Clark
articles.summary: Bosch Digital has been named a finalist in the SAP Innovation Awards 2025 for its use of artificial intelligence across its SAP landscape. Bosch leveraged SAP Business Technology Platform, clean core principles, and an internal AI Academy to train more than 1,000 consultants in building and deploying AI agents. These agents now resolve nearly 20% of internal invoice inquiries autonomously.

articles.title: Meta taps ChatGPT co-creator Shengjia Zhao as Chief Scientist of AI Superintelligence division
articles.author: Nileena Sunil
articles.summary: Shengjia Zhao will be the chief scientist at Meta's new AI unit, Meta Superintelligence Labs (MSL). He will work under former Scale CEO Alexandr Wang, who is heading the superintelligence unit. Zhao has contributed to many of OpenAI's biggest breakthroughs including ChatGPT, GPT-4 and the company's first AI reasoning model, o1. MSL will focus on foundation models such as the open-source Llama family of AI models, products and Fundamental Artificial Intelligence Research projects.

articles.title: Microsoft updates Edge browser with AI-based Copilot mode
articles.author: Global Data
articles.summary: Microsoft has introduced a new AI-driven Copilot Mode in its Edge browser. The mode is available for free on Windows and Mac PCs for a limited period. It helps users organise browsing into topic-based queries and facilitates comparison of results across open tabs without the need to toggle between them.

articles.title: As Data Centers Multiply In The Chesapeake Region, Water Use Increases Too
articles.author: Bay Journal
articles.summary: Data centers house the computer systems that enable internet activity and, increasingly, artificial intelligence. Northern Virginia is home to the world's largest concentration of data centers. The growth of data center construction in Virginia alone nearly doubled the demand for electricity from the region's grid in the second half of 2024.

articles.title: How US adults are using AI, according to AP-NORC polling
articles.author: Matt O'Brien
articles.summary: 60% of U.S. adults use artificial intelligence to find information at least some of the time. Younger adults are most likely to use AI for brainstorming and work tasks, according to a new poll from Associated Press-NORC Center for Public Affairs Research.

articles.title: How US adults are using AI, according to AP-NORC polling
articles.author: MATT O’BRIEN
articles.summary: Most U.S. adults say they use artificial intelligence to search for information, but fewer are using it for work, drafting email or shopping. Younger adults are most likely to use AI for brainstorming and work tasks. About 4 in 10 Americans say they have used AI for work tasks at least sometimes.

articles.title: How US adults are using AI, according to AP-NORC polling
articles.author: MATT O'BRIEN
articles.summary: Most U.S. adults say they use artificial intelligence to search for information, but fewer are using it for work, drafting email or shopping. Younger adults are most likely to use AI for brainstorming and work tasks. About 6 in 10 adults under 30 have used AI for coming up with ideas, compared with 2 in 10 of those age 60 or older.

articles.title: Trump order targets 'woke' AI
articles.author: Matt O'Brien
articles.summary: Trump signed an AI executive order aimed at "preventing woke AI" in the federal government. It's the first time the U.S. government has tried to shape the ideological behavior of AI. It will be difficult for tech companies to comply with it. The order's call for "truth-seeking" AI echoes the language of the president's adviser Elon Musk.

articles.title: The Real Demon Inside ChatGPT
articles.author: Wired
articles.summary: AI chatbots strip language of its historical and cultural context. Sometimes what looks like a satanic bloodletting ritual may actually be lifted from Warhammer 40,000 or some other sci-fi movie or book.  iReport.com: What do you think? Share your thoughts.

articles.title: WAIC 2025: GPTBots Multi-Agent Platform Turns AI Tools into Collaborative Teams
articles.author: GPTBots
articles.summary: 2025 World Artificial Intelligence Conference is underway in Shanghai. GPTBots.ai showcased its cutting-edge AI capabilities with the launch of its Multi-Agent Collaboration Platform. The platform addresses key challenges in enterprise AI adoption, including data silos, rigid workflows, and lack of control over outcomes.

articles.title: ‘Alarming' Reports Spark Concerns About America's Organ Donation System
articles.author: FOX News Radio
articles.summary: President Trump announced America's AI action plan. Congressman Jay Obernolte (R-CA) is co-chair of the U.S. Congressional Artificial Intelligence Task Force. Health Resources and Services Administration reviewed over 350 organ transplant cases managed by Kentucky Organ Donor Affiliates and found a disturbing trend. Dr. Raymond Lynch, chief of the organ transplant branch, joins the podcast to discuss the report.

articles.title: Advancing Eco Agriculture (AEA) Launches FieldLark AI: the World's First AI Chatbot for Regenerative Agronomy
articles.author: Joplin Globe
articles.summary: FieldLark AI is the world's first AI chatbot for regenerative agronomy. FieldLark delivers AEA's decades of in-field experience and biological insights to growers via a browser on mobile devices or computers anytime, anywhere. It's free to anyone interested in regenerative growing.

articles.title: Agora Showcases Conversational AI Solutions at the World Artificial Intelligence Conference
articles.author: Agora
articles.summary: Agora showcased its conversational AI solutions at the World Artificial Intelligence Conference in Shanghai during July 26-29, 2025. Agora unveiled key upcoming features of its Conversational AI Engine, including the new "Conversational AI Voice" feature.

articles.title: Leading With Artificial Talent: How Agentic AI Is Reshaping The Future Of Leadership
articles.author: Chih-Han Yu
articles.summary: Dr. Chih-Han Yu is the CEO and Cofounder of Appier, an AI SaaS company. He believes that the future of business will be driven by AI. He suggests that businesses must design for intelligence from the ground up.

articles.title: How AI Is Changing Marketing Communications
articles.author: Kurt Allen
articles.summary: Kurt Allen is Vice President, Marketing & Communications at Notre Dame de Namur University. He has worked in banking, financial services and now higher education for 25 years. In his experience, he has seen how AI is reshaping the entire marketing discipline. AI can help to personalize messaging, optimize campaign performance and predict customer behavior.

articles.title: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman Claims AI Can Diagnose Faster and Better Than Many Doctors, Yet People Still Prefer MDs: I'm Like…
articles.author: Arezki Amiri
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is revolutionizing how we approach medical care. In recent years, AI has made significant strides in healthcare, especially in diagnostic roles. AI can outperform human doctors in certain tasks, but many people still prefer to consult a doctor in person.

articles.title: AI dependency threatens creativity across Pakistan's classrooms
articles.author: Urdu Point
articles.summary: Artificial Intelligence is already inside Pakistan's classrooms helping students with writing, research, language learning, and even math problems. Tools like ChatGPT, Grammarly, and Google Bard are becoming silent study tools.  Urdu Point and Pakistan Point News are published in Urdu.

articles.title: 'I worry about whether the revolution will be for good or bad'
articles.author: Jeff D'Alessio
articles.summary: In Part 6 of our continuing series on the future of artificial intelligence, a UI College of Veterinary Medicine faculty member and an engineering alum share their crystal balls on the AI revolution in medicine, space exploration, and robotic medicine.   In 10-20 years, AI-enabled tools will lead to advances in robotic medicine that will enable humans to have increased access to health care.

articles.title: OKC Council approves contract with controversial AI facial recognition company
articles.author: Jessie Christopher Smith
articles.summary: Oklahoma City police have a contract with a New York-based artificial intelligence facial recognition company, Clearview AI Inc., for $37,250 a year. Two council members voted against the agreement, which passed 7-2. The company is facing numerous lawsuits and was fined over $30 million by a Dutch data protection agency for building an illegal database containing billions of faces from social media. The U.S. Commission on Civil Rights found the technology disproportionately harms women and people of color.

articles.title: Report Urges Data Shift to Boost AI in Primary Care
articles.author: Mirage News
articles.summary: Large-scale, well organized and open datasets are necessary for primary care-focused artificial intelligence and machine learning (AI/ML) research and development. Data transformation to advance AI/ML research and implementation in primary care requires cross-sectoral collaborations between government, industry, professional organizations, and academia.

articles.title: AI superintelligence talent war: How Big Tech chases the technology's best brains
articles.author: Timothy Rooks
articles.summary: There is a growing demand for experienced AI engineers and a shortage of qualified people in the field. Big Tech companies like Meta and Microsoft are spending a lot of money on hiring AI experts. Some in the startup industry fear a broader cultural change where bigger companies are cherry-picking the parts they want and leaving behind the rest.

articles.title: AI Struggles With Sarcasm in Non-American English
articles.author: Mirage News
articles.summary: Aditya Joshi has recently moved to Australia. He studied English for more than 20 years. It took him a while to familiarise himself with the Australian variety of the language. Large language models powered by artificial intelligence (AI) such as ChatGPT experience a similar problem. Joshi and his colleagues developed BESSTIE, a benchmark for sentiment and sarcasm classification of three varieties of English: Australian English, Indian English and British English.

articles.title: Search Transformed: The Rise Of Agentic AI
articles.author: Adrien Menard
articles.summary: AI agents and bots are reshaping the future of search. Today, AI bots and agents drive more than 50% of web traffic on Botify clients' e-commerce websites. They will use website content on behalf of consumers to learn about brands and make recommendations within AI search platforms in a matter of seconds.

articles.title: Meltwater Launches GenAI Lens for Brand Insights
articles.author: Mirage News
articles.summary: Meltwater's GenAI Lens gives companies unprecedented visibility into how their brand, competitors and industry are discussed across all major AI Assistants and LLMs (Large Language Models) including ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini, Perplexity, Grok, and Deepseek.

articles.title: How Google's AI mode works as new feature set to hit UK browsers this week
articles.author: David Snelling
articles.summary: Google's new AI mode is set to launch in the UK this week. It will allow web users to find detailed answers to all of their queries no matter how complicated. Most of the UK is expected to have access to this handy feature by the end of the week.

articles.title: Vogue Erupts: AI-Generated Models Spark Reader Fury And Industry Panic
articles.author: Moin Roberts-Islam
articles.summary: A two-page spread in the August edition of Vogue has sparked controversy for using AI models. The Guess ad was created using generative algorithms trained on runway looks, campaign shots and studio lighting setup. The reaction has been visceral. Long-time subscribers have cancelled their subscriptions.

articles.title: Does Greater Cleveland want us to use AI to solve our toxic comment problem: The Readers Write
articles.author: Chris Quinn
articles.summary: Cleveland.com shut down its comments section in 2020. Many readers would like to see it re-opened, but some are sceptical about AI's ability to filter out hate speech and off-topic comments. The New York Times and Washington Post use AI to moderate their comments.

articles.title: Scientists use quantum machine learning to create semiconductors for the first time – and it could transform how chips are made
articles.summary: Scientists in Australia have developed a quantum machine learning technique that could change how microchips are made. It's a blend of artificial intelligence (AI) and quantum computing principles. It can improve the process of modeling the electrical resistance inside a chip, a key factor that affects how efficiently it performs.

articles.title: Best AI Accounting Assistant 2025: QuickBooks' Intuit Assist Recognized by Better Business Advice
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: Better Business Advice has recognized Intuit Assist, the generative AI platform embedded in QuickBooks, as a top solution in the emerging field of AI-powered accounting assistants for 2025. QuickBooks is a platform that aims to reduce friction across common business tasks. It uses business data to generate personalized suggestions, automate transactions and monitor cash flow activity.

articles.title: Inside the collapse of Builder.ai: Was it even an AI company?
articles.author: Varsha Bansal
articles.summary: Builder.ai was founded by Sachin Dev Duggal in 2012 and valued at $1.5 billion. It promised to use AI to radically simplify the process of building software and reduce human labor. Former employees say the company used human workers and outsourced developers for most of its work. Some prospective clients walked away after hearing how long their projects would take to complete.

articles.title: Mole Mobile is coming to Hamilton on Aug. 3
articles.author: Démar Grant
articles.summary: The Mole Mobile is coming to Hamilton on Sunday, August 3. It will set up at Fortinos at 65 Mall Rd. from 10 a.m.-4 p.m. It is the first mobile skin cancer screening unit in Canada. Until October, the tour will bring certified Canadian dermatologists to communities across British Columbia, Ontario, Quebec and Alberta. The tour will also stop in Fort Erie, Niagara Falls and St. Catharines.

articles.title: Fortnite Server Status: Return Timeline After v36.30 Outage
articles.summary: A new artificial intelligence system has been successfully integrated. It aims to deepen user engagement and streamline the delivery of relevant content and experiences. It analyzes user behavior and preferences in real-time to provide hyper-personalized interactions. This not only boosts user satisfaction and cultivates loyalty and encourages repeat engagement.

articles.title: AI isn't only taking jobs: The new technology is causing electricity bills to skyrocket this summer
articles.summary: AI-powered chatbots and data centers are increasing demand for electricity. PJM Interconnection reports a $9 billion increase in power costs attributed to AI and data center demand this summer. Fossil fuel power plants are being retired and wind and solar energy sources are facing problems. This combination is increasing electricity prices.

articles.title: Will Indian-origin CEOs caught up in browser battle, Comet aiming to strike Google
articles.author: Hindustan Times
articles.summary: In recent months, the AI war between tech giants has shifted from chatbots to AI-powered browsers. Google, OpenAI, and Perplexity have already laid the foundations towards the shift. Perplexities' new AI browser is based on Google's AI browser.

articles.title: Bluesky's CEO warns you shouldn't 'fully outsource your thinking' to AI
articles.author: Ana Altchek
articles.summary: Bluesky CEO Jay Graber believes critical thinking is still necessary in this day and age. AI is able to automate a lot of critical-reasoning tasks, but it's not good enough to run in an automated fashion. AI can help insert structure, figure out bugs, and generate code, but you still need to have a solid foundation of skills before using it.

articles.title: ExactSearch.AI Launches to Transform Executive Search with Transparent Pricing and AI-Driven Precision
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.summary: ExactSearch.AI launched a new model for retained executive search. It offers faster results, partner-led service, and fees at half the cost of traditional retained search firms. ExactSearch AI will be available in 2025.

articles.title: AI-Powered Diagnostics and Digital Support for Lyme Disease and Adolescent Health
articles.author: Dr. Priya Deshmukh
articles.summary: Lyme Disease Diagnostic Test uses a unique method to detect 10 specific proteins associated with the infection. It is projected to be commercially available by the end of 2026. A study compared ChatGPT-4 to Medicine-GPT, a free AI chatbot for medical data aimed at teenagers.

articles.title: Microsoft study identifies 40 jobs AI chatbots are likely to help automate — and those where the tech is barely being used
articles.author: Brent D. Griffiths
articles.summary: Researchers analyzed 200,000 conversations with Microsoft Copilot chatbot. They found that the jobs most likely to be affected by AI are providing and communicating information. The least affected jobs are phlebotomists, nursing assistants, and hazardous materials removal workers. The paper doesn't cover whether interpreters and translators should be fearful about their future.

articles.title: Microsoft study identifies 40 jobs AI chatbots are likely to help automate — and those where the tech is barely being used
articles.summary: Researchers analyzed 200,000 conversations with Microsoft Copilot chatbot. They found that the jobs most likely to be affected by AI are translators, historians, and writers. The least affected jobs were phlebotomists, nursing assistants, and hazardous materials removal workers.

articles.title: Aurora Mobile Unveils New Multi-Agent Collaboration Capabilities for GPTBots.ai at WAIC 2025
articles.author: Aurora Mobile Limited
articles.summary: Aurora Mobile announced the launch of new Multi-Agent collaboration capabilities within its GPTBots.ai platform at the 2025 World Artificial Intelligence Conference (WAIC 2025) in Shanghai. The new functionality is designed to help enterprises build customized AI agents and overcome key challenges in AI implementation.

articles.title: Hammerling-Hodgers: Understand the benefits and drawbacks of different skin cancer treatments
articles.author: Susan Hammerling-Hodgers
articles.summary: Mohs surgery is a precise treatment for skin cancer with a high cure rate. EBT is beneficial for larger or deeper skin cancers, especially on irregular surfaces like the nose or ear. Radiation therapy can remove skin cancers almost as effectively as surgery and without scarring.

articles.title: Students, why are you here?
articles.author: Matthew Boedy
articles.summary: In his first day lecture at the University of North Georgia he will try to convince his students not to use artificial intelligence in their writing classes. He believes students in his class have used AI extensively and haven't admitted it. Two decades ago he went to college to become a journalist.

articles.title: Schools turn to AI to identify campus threats
articles.author: Adam Beam
articles.summary: Some Atlanta public schools have started using AI to assess their security camera footage, prompting automatic alerts if the system detects a gun or other security threats. The state Legislature approved the funding earlier this year in response to the school shooting at Apalachee High School in Barrow County last year.

articles.title: Clemson researchers discovered hundreds of bots on X using AI to stoke controversy over Epstein files
